author: Staff Reporter
text:
Residents of Surya Nagar in Kotturpuram on Sunday resisted attempts by Chennai Corporation to evict and relocate them to Semmenchery.

Officials wanted to evict many families living along banks of the Adyar river, but due to the stiff resistance, the officials put off the move, said G. Selva of Communist Party of India (Marxist). “We resisted and prevented the families from being sent out as their livelihood will be affected if they are relocated. People who have shifted there are complaining about the problems they face on a daily basis,” he said.

“If people have to be relocated, it has to be within a three-kilometre radius and not outside the city limits. How can students in class X and Plus Two cope up, with public examinations just a few weeks away,” he asked.

M. Senthil Kumar, a resident of Surya Nagar, said his family had been living here for four generations and he would not leave.

“My children study in Kotturpuram and it is neither possible to travel 25 km every day nor can we afford to spend on the commute, he said. Chennai Corporation said it was planning to arrange more special buses for school students who had been relocated.
title: Surya Nagar families refuse to relocate
